posts.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams
posts.cooked: Hi! “Lituanica X” represents a community of FTC teams in Lithuania ( https://www.lituanicax.lt/ ). One of our FTC teams will be competing at the World Championship this week. We are planning to start an FRC team next year. Perhaps some FRC teams could sell us some used gearboxes for CIM and/or 775 motors? Would it be possible to purchase these and pick them up in Houston? Thank you! Good luck to all FIRST teams!
posts.display_username: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams

posts.cooked: Is it an option for you to use Houston pit delivery?  they deliver straight to the pits.

posts.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams
posts.cooked: Thank you for your reaction. We hope that we could pay less for used gearboxes.
posts.display_username: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams

posts.cooked: I know that a lot of swerve drive teams will give them out for free since they have so many of them. So I hope you can get a set of them if we were attending I would give you one

reply_to_user.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams

posts.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams
posts.cooked: Thank you again for your reaction! Could you send to address in US? We will take care of shipping to Lithuania then. Could you write your contacts to lituanicax@gmail.com ? Looking forward to continue cooperation with your team!
posts.display_username: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
thegravitor:

Is it an option for you to use Houston pit delivery? they deliver straight to the pits.

Most vendors’ deadlines on that have passed anyway (the last one I think is REV, whose deadline is noon Central today).

lituanicax:

Thank you for your reaction. We hope that we could pay less for used gearboxes.

You may actually have a harder time with that than getting freebies–lots of the teams are associated with schools with weird rules about selling stuff (versus “it’s junk, toss it”–which can more easily be tossed in your direction).

Have you reached out to the other EU-based FRC teams?  Several are well-established by now, and that could be a route to older parts that don’t require a ton of import headaches.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.custom_user_title: says you should come to SCRIW in October

posts.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams
posts.cooked: Thank you for your response! We are in contact with EU-based FRC teams. They are still not as developed as teams in the US. That’s why we are trying to use the World Championships to get some help with used parts.
posts.display_username: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams

posts.cooked: We are a school sponsored team so we have to go through the school sending packages out and they are a hassle to work with so if we can I will send a email

reply_to_user.name: Lituanica X - Lithuanian community of teams
